result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholas Jerome Beach was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
***AMENDED***
Per Judge Edward F. Vlack April 23, 2015 - Defendant is entitled to 65 days credit under 973.155.


Defendant to report to Probation by 3:00 p.m. March 2, 2015.
Probation to run concurrent.

 

In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Concurrent with:

miscConds.notes: Psychological/Psychiatric Evaluation within 30 days if requested by Agent.

-Cooperate with any program as directed by Agent.
-Defendant to provide a DNA Sample.
-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.
-Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license.
-Restorative Justice Program if requested by Victim.
-Maintain full-time/part-time employment.
-Random UA's and PBT's.
-No Contact with K. McCarthy or L. Robl.
-Follow all rules and regulations of Agent.
-Pay Supervision fees.
AODA within 30 days and follow all recommendations successfully.

CO: Vlack, DAR: Frank, Clerk: Minot,ADA:  Sharon Correll   DF ATTY:  Jeremiah James Harrelson   DF:  Nicholas Jerome Beach appeared. Includes 14CF322, 14CF420, 14CF443. Case called at 3:20 pm. ADA Correll makes recommendations. No objection from Atty Harrelson.   Court reviews constitutional rights with def. Court finds Def freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights. Court reads charge and possible penalties for count one and two in 14CF322 and Count 3 in 14CF443, def pleads Guilty. Court uses complaints and reports as factual basis, accepts plea and adjudicates Def guilty of Count 1 and Count 2 on 14CF322 and Guilty of Count 3 in 14CF443. Counts 1 and 2 in 14CF443 are dismissed but read in for purposes of restitution. 14CF420 is also dismissed and read in for purposes of restitution. Sentencing arguements. Court orders:
On Count 1 in 14CF322 - 3 years Probation W/H
- Court Costs
- Restition to be held open for 60 Days
- Jail 120 Days STAYED
- AODA and follow through
- Psychological/Psychiatric Evaluation if requested by Agent

- DNA Sample and surcharge on Count 1 in 14CF322
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.
- Not to possess a firearm
- Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid license
- Restortive Justice
- Maintain Employment
- Random UA's and PBT's
- No contact with K. Mccarthy or L. Robl
- Follow all rules and regulations of Agent
- Pay supervision fees
To sign up for probation by 3:00 pm on 3/2/2015
90 credit against ultimate sentence

2 years probation

On 14CF443, Count #3
2 years probation

Probation to run concurrent

TO ALSO INCLUDE 14CF322, 14CF420 and 14CF443:

$750.00 bond on file.

Total bond amount of $5,000. $3,750 signature bond with mother Laura Crimmins to co-sign and $1,250 cash.

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Lloyd R.  and Katie M. The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.

Includes 14CF420, 14CF443 & 14CF322.
